definitions.definition: The state of having no job; joblessness.
The phenomenon of joblessness in an economy .
examples: Unemployment has been considered a cause of crime.

definitions.definition: The level of joblessness in an economy, often measured as a percentage of the workforce .
examples: Unemployment was reported at 5.2% in May, up from 4.9% in April.

definitions.definition: A type of joblessness due to a particular economic mechanism.
examples: All unemployments , seasonal, frictional, cyclical, classical, whatever, mean that you're out of work.

definitions.definition: An instance or period of joblessness.
examples: Until then his life had consisted of low-paying jobs, numerous unemployments , and drug use.

main_definition: The state of having no job; joblessness.
secondary_definitions: The phenomenon of joblessness in an economy .
The level of joblessness in an economy, often measured as a percentage of the workforce .
( countable ) A type of joblessness due to a particular economic mechanism.
( countable ) An instance or period of joblessness.
